definition: to expel/to urge on/to drive/to run quickly

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.english: He was declared persona non grata and thrown out of the country.
sentences.chinese: 他被这个国家宣布为不受欢迎的人并被驱逐出境。

sentences.english: The leftist leader already had expelled the U.S. ambassador six months earlier.
sentences.chinese: 早在六个月前左派领导人已经把美国大使驱逐出境。

sentences.english: The authorities deported her for illegal entry.
sentences.chinese: 当局以她非法入境为由将她驱逐出境。

sentences.english: So if they do complain, they risk being deported.
sentences.chinese: 因此如果她们提出申诉，她们就有被驱逐出境的危险。

sentences.english: Exhaust gases are expelled from the engine by compressed-air scavenging.
sentences.chinese: 废气被驱逐出境的引擎的压缩空气清除。

sentences.english: So John, if he had been deported, Yoko would've stayed behind.
sentences.chinese: 所以如果约翰被驱逐出境，洋子将继续留在美国。

sentences.english: And Saul had the mediums and the soothsayers put out of the land.
sentences.chinese: 扫罗曾将交鬼的和行巫术的人驱逐出境。

sentences.english: The government set about eliminating the religions with mass executions and deportations.
sentences.chinese: 政府着手消除了宗教与大规模处决和驱逐出境。

sentences.english: The six are accused of murder, deportations, and persecutions.
sentences.chinese: 这六名嫌疑犯被指控谋杀，驱逐出境和迫害。

sentences.english: Let’s be a nation not for deportation, but for education.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家不能把人民驱逐出境，教育也不能。

sentences.english: No to deportations -defend the right to asylum and the rights of economic immigrants.
sentences.chinese: 不要驱逐出境，维护庇护权的权利和经济移民。

definition: to repatriate (e.g. prisoners of war)/to send back
to imprison/to jail/to take into custody
to escort a criminal under guard (in former times)
an execution/to put sb to death
